de.interactive_instruments.etf.bsxm

Class GmlGeoX

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.basex.query.QueryModule
      • de.interactive_instruments.etf.bsxm.GmlGeoX

  • public class GmlGeoX
extends org.basex.query.QueryModule
    This module supports the validation of geometries as well as computing the spatial relationship between geometries.

    NOTE 1: the validation and spatial relationship methods only support specific sets of geometry types - please see the documentation of the respective methods for details on which geometry types are supported.

        configurationDirectoryPathName - Path to a directory that contains SRS configuration files
        Throws:
        org.basex.query.QueryException - in case that the SRS configuration directory does not exist, is not a directory, cannot be read, or an exception occurred while loading the configuration files

      • validate

        public java.lang.String validate(org.basex.query.value.node.ANode node)
                          throws org.basex.query.QueryException
        Calls the validate(ANode, String) method, with null as the bitmask, resulting in a validation with all tests enabled.

        See the documentation of the validate(ANode, String) method for a description of the supported geometry types.

        Parameters:
        node - Node
        Returns:
        a mask with the test results, encoded as characters - one at each position (1-based index) of the available tests. 'V' indicates that the test passed, i.e. that the geometry is valid according to that test. 'F' indicates that the test failed. 'S' indicates that the test was skipped. Example: the string 'SVF' shows that the first test was skipped, while the second test passed and the third failed.
        Throws:
        org.basex.query.QueryException

      • validate

        public java.lang.String validate(org.basex.query.value.node.ANode node,
                                 java.lang.String testMask)
                          throws org.basex.query.QueryException
        Validates the given (GML geometry) node.

        By default validation is only performed for the following GML geometry elements: Point, Polygon, Surface, Curve, LinearRing, MultiPolygon, MultiGeometry, MultiSurface, MultiCurve, Ring, and LineString. The set of GML elements to validate can be modified via the following methods: registerGmlGeometry(String), unregisterGmlGeometry(String), and unregisterAllGmlGeometries(). These methods are also available for XQueries.

        The validation tasks to perform can be specified via the given mask. The mask is a simple string, where the character '1' at the position of a specific test (assuming a 1-based index) specifies that the test shall be performed. If the mask does not contain a character at the position of a specific test (because the mask is empty or the length is smaller than the position), then the test will be executed.

        The following tests are available:

        Position Test Name Description
        1 General Validation This test validates the given geometry using the validation functionality of both deegree and JTS.
        2 Polygon Patch Connectivity Checks that multiple polygon patches within a single surface are connected.
        3 Repetition of Position in CurveSegments Checks that consecutive positions within a CurveSegment are not equal.

        Examples:

        • The mask '010' indicates that only the 'Polygon Patch Connectivity' test shall be performed.
        • The mask '1' indicates that all tests shall be performed (because the first one is set to true/'1' and nothing is said for the other tests).
        • The mask '0' indicates that all except the first test shall be performed.
        Parameters:
        node - the GML geometry to validate
        testMask - test mask
        Returns:
        a mask with the test results, encoded as characters - one at each position (1-based index) of the available tests. 'V' indicates that the test passed, i.e. that the geometry is valid according to that test. 'F' indicates that the test failed. 'S' indicates that the test was skipped. Example: the string 'SVF' shows that the first test was skipped, while the second test passed and the third failed.
        Throws:
        org.basex.query.QueryException

      • validateAndReport

        public org.w3c.dom.Element validateAndReport(org.basex.query.value.node.ANode node)
                                      throws org.basex.query.QueryException
        Throws:
        org.basex.query.QueryException

      • validateAndReport

        public org.w3c.dom.Element validateAndReport(org.basex.query.value.node.ANode node,
                                             java.lang.String testMask)
                                      throws org.basex.query.QueryException
        Parameters:
        node - Node
        testMask - test mask
        Returns:
        a DOM element like the following: 
                 
         <ggeo:ValidationResult xmlns:ggeo="de.interactive_instruments.etf.bsxm.GmlGeoX">
           <ggeo:isValid>false</ggeo:isValid>
           <ggeo:result>VFV</ggeo:result>
           <ggeo:message type="NOTICE">Detected GML standard version: GML3.2.</ggeo:message>
           <ggeo:message type="ERROR">Invalid surface (gml:id: s14). The patches of the surface are not connected.</ggeo:message>
         </ggeo:ValidationResult>
        Where:
        • ggeo:isValid - contains the boolean value indicating if the object passed all tests (defined by the testMask).
        • ggeo:result - contains a string that is a mask with the test results, encoded as characters - one at each position (1-based index) of the available tests. 'V' indicates that the test passed, i.e. that the geometry is valid according to that test. 'F' indicates that the test failed. 'S' indicates that the test was skipped. Example: the string 'SVF' shows that the first test was skipped, while the second test passed and the third failed
        • ggeo:message (one for each message produced during validation) contains:
          • an XML attribute 'type' that indicates the severity level of the message ('FATAL', 'ERROR', 'WARNING', or 'NOTICE')
          • the actual validation message as text content
        Throws:
        org.basex.query.QueryException
        See Also:
        executeValidate(ANode, String)

      • contains

        public boolean contains(java.lang.Object arg1,
                        java.lang.Object arg2)
                 throws org.basex.query.QueryException
        Tests if the first geometry contains the second geometry.

        See {GmlGeoXUtils.toJTSGeometry(Geometry) for a list of supported and unsupported geometry types.

        Parameters:
        arg1 - represents the first geometry, encoded as a GML geometry element
        arg2 - represents the second geometry, encoded as a GML geometry element
        Returns:
        true if the first geometry contains the second one, else false.
        Throws:
        org.basex.query.QueryException

      • contains

        public boolean contains(java.lang.Object arg1,
                        java.lang.Object arg2,
                        boolean matchAll)
                 throws org.basex.query.QueryException
        Tests if one geometry contains a list of geometries. Whether a match is required for all or just one of these is controlled via parameter.

        See {GmlGeoXUtils.toJTSGeometry(Geometry) for a list of supported and unsupported geometry types.

        Parameters:
        arg1 - represents the first geometry, encoded as a GML geometry element
        arg2 - represents a list of geometries, encoded as a GML geometry element
        matchAll - true if arg1 must fulfill the spatial relationship for all geometries in arg2, else false
        Returns:
        true if the conditions are met, else false. false will also be returned if arg2 is empty.
        Throws:
        org.basex.query.QueryException

      • determineSrsName

        public org.basex.query.value.Value determineSrsName(org.basex.query.value.Value geometryElement)
                                             throws org.basex.query.QueryException
        Determine the name of the SRS that applies to the given geometry element. The SRS is either defined by the element itself, in the 'srsName', or by the nearest ancestor that either has an 'srsName' attribute or a child element with local name 'boundedBy' (like gml:boundedBy) that itself contains a child element (like gml:Envelope) that has an 'srsName' attribute. NOTE: The underlying query is independent of a specific GML namespace.
        Parameters:
        geometryElement -
        Returns:
        the value of the applicable 'srsName' attribute, if found, otherwise the empty sequence
        Throws:
        org.basex.query.QueryException

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty(com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Geometry geom)

      • isClosed

        public boolean isClosed(java.lang.Object o)
                 throws org.basex.query.QueryException
        Checks if a given object is closed. The object can be a single geometry or a collection of geometries. Only LineStrings and MultiLineStrings are checked. NOTE: Invokes the isClosed(Object, boolean) method, with true for the second parameter.
        Parameters:
        o -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        org.basex.query.QueryException
        See Also:
        isClosed(Object, boolean)

      • isClosed

        public boolean isClosed(java.lang.Object o,
                        boolean onlyCheckCurveGeometries)
                 throws org.basex.query.QueryException
        Checks if a given object is closed. The object can be a single geometry or a collection of geometries. Points and MultiPoints are closed by definition (they do not have a boundary). Polygons and MultiPolygons are never closed in 2D, and since operations in 3D are not supported, this method will always return false if a polygon is encountered - unless the parameter onlyCheckCurveGeometries is set to true. LinearRings are closed by definition. The remaining geometry types that will be checked are LineString and MultiLineString. If a (Multi)LineString is not closed, this method will return false.
        Parameters:
        o - the geometry object(s) to test, can be a JTS geometry object, collection, and BaseX nodes (that will be converted to JTS geometries)
        onlyCheckCurveGeometries - true if only curve geometries (i.e., for JTS: LineString, LinearRing, and MultiLineString) shall be tested, else false (in this case, the occurrence of polygons will result in the return value false).
        Returns:
        true if the given object - a geometry or collection of geometries - is closed, else false
        Throws:
        org.basex.query.QueryException

      • holes

        public com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Geometry holes(com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Geometry geom)
        Identifies the holes contained in the given geometry (can be a Polygon, MultiPolygon, or any other JTS geometry) and returns them as a JTS geometry. If holes were found a union is built, to ensure that the result is a valid JTS Polygon or JTS MultiPolygon. If no holes were found an empty JTS GeometryCollection is returned.
        Parameters:
        geom - potentially existing holes will be extracted from this geometry
        Returns:
        A geometry with the holes contained in the given geometry. Can be empty but not null;

                throws org.basex.query.QueryException
        Throws:
        org.basex.query.QueryException

      • relate

        public boolean relate(java.lang.Object arg1,
                      java.lang.Object arg2,
                      java.lang.String intersectionPattern)
               throws org.basex.query.QueryException
        Tests if the first geometry relates to the second geometry as defined by the given intersection pattern.

        See {GmlGeoXUtils.toJTSGeometry(Geometry) for a list of supported and unsupported geometry types.

        Parameters:
        arg1 - represents the first geometry, encoded as a GML geometry element
        arg2 - represents the second geometry, encoded as a GML geometry element
        intersectionPattern - the pattern against which to check the intersection matrix for the two geometries (IxI,IxB,IxE,BxI,BxB,BxE,ExI,ExB,ExE)
        Returns:
        true if the DE-9IM intersection matrix for the two geometries matches the intersectionPattern, else false.
        Throws:
        org.basex.query.QueryException

      • relate

        public boolean relate(java.lang.Object arg1,
                      java.lang.Object arg2,
                      java.lang.String intersectionPattern,
                      boolean matchAll)
               throws org.basex.query.QueryException
        Tests if one geometry relates to a list of geometries as defined by the given intersection pattern. Whether a match is required for all or just one of these is controlled via parameter.

        See {GmlGeoXUtils.toJTSGeometry(Geometry) for a list of supported and unsupported geometry types.

        Parameters:
        arg1 - represents the first geometry, encoded as a GML geometry element
        arg2 - represents a list of geometries, encoded as a GML geometry
        intersectionPattern - the pattern against which to check the intersection matrix for the geometries (IxI,IxB,IxE,BxI,BxB,BxE,ExI,ExB,ExE)
        matchAll - true if arg1 must fulfill the spatial relationship defined by the intersectionPattern for all geometries in arg2, else false
        Returns:
        true if the conditions are met, else false. false will also be returned if arg2 is empty.
        Throws:
        org.basex.query.QueryException

      • intersection

        public com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Geometry intersection(java.lang.Object arg1,
                                                         java.lang.Object arg2)

        Parameters:
        arg1 - represents the first geometry
        arg2 - represents the second geometry
        Returns:
        the point-set common to the two geometries
        Throws:
        org.basex.query.QueryException

      • search

        public java.lang.Object[] search(java.lang.Object minx,
                                 java.lang.Object miny,
                                 java.lang.Object maxx,
                                 java.lang.Object maxy)
                          throws org.basex.query.QueryException
        Searches the spatial r-tree index for items in the envelope.

        miny - represents the minimum value on the second coordinate axis; a number
        maxx - represents the maximum value on the first coordinate axis; a number
        maxy - represents the maximum value on the second coordinate axis; a number
        Returns:
        the node set of all items in the envelope
        Throws:
        org.basex.query.QueryException

      • index

        public void index(java.lang.Object pre,
                  java.lang.Object dbname,
                  java.lang.Object id,
                  java.lang.Object geom)
           throws org.basex.query.QueryException
        Indexes a list of id nodes (gml:id attribute of features) with their GML geometries

        See GmlGeoXUtils.toJTSGeometry(Geometry) for a list of supported and unsupported geometry types.

        Both lists must have equal length.

        Parameters:
        pre - represents the pre value of the indexed item node (typically the gml:id of GML feature elements)
        dbname - represents the name of the database that contains the indexed item node (typically the gml:id of GML feature elements)
        id - represents the id string of the item that should be indexed, typically the gml:id of GML feature elements; must be String instances
        geom - represents the GML geometry to index; must be an BXElem instance
        Throws:
        org.basex.query.QueryException

      • getGeometry

        public com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Geometry getGeometry(java.lang.Object id,
                                                        java.lang.Object defgeom)
                                                 throws org.basex.query.QueryException
        Retrieve the geometry of an item as a JTS geometry. First try the cache and if it is not in the cache construct it from the XML.

        See GmlGeoXUtils.toJTSGeometry(Geometry) for a list of supported and unsupported geometry types.

        Parameters:
        id - the id for which the geometry should be retrieved, typically a gml:id of a GML feature element; must be a String or BXNode instance
        defgeom - represents the default GML geometry, if the geometry is not cached; must be a BXElem instance
        Returns:
        the geometry of the indexed node, or null if no geometry was found
        Throws:
        org.basex.query.QueryException
